sn3.2:1.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said to him:
sn3.2:1.3: “Venerable sir, how many things are there which, when they arise within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort?”
sn3.2:2.1: “There are, great king, three things which, when they arise within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:2.3: Greed, great king,  when arises within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:2.4: Hatred great king,  when arises within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:2.5: Delusion great king,  when arises within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:2.6: “These three, great king, are three things which, when they arise within a person, arise for his harm, suffering, and discomfort. ”
sn3.2:3.3: Injure the person of evil mind
sn3.2:3.4: As its own fruit destroys the reed.
